pairwise_eval.degeneration_llm_reason: Multiple answers display severe repetition ([0], [10], [9]), garbled structure ([2], [13], [14]), broken or nonsensical language ([11], [6], [2]), incomplete outputs ([7], [3], [5]), and language/token mixing ([12]). Only a few responses are minimally coherent. On average, the set shows high degeneration.

llm_diversity.justification: While the samples share a central theme of waiting and often similar language, there is moderate diversity in style (some poetic, some narrative, some fragmented), characters (young women, abstract figures, a boy), settings (Paris, a village, unspecified locations), and occasional use of multilingual or experimental language, though the overall perspective and plot remain highly repetitive.

per_prompt.prompt: You thought he was dead, but there he is, right in front of you on the street, smiling at you.

pairwise_eval.degeneration_llm_reason: Most answers are coherent and clean, but several responses exhibit degeneration: [5] contains garbled phrasing and broken language with inserted non-English symbols; [6] is somewhat nonsensical and repetitive; [8] is empty; [9] is incoherent and has awkward phrasing; [12] and [13] contain noticeable repetition and some awkward constructions. Overall, the average level of degeneration is moderate.

llm_diversity.justification: Most samples repeat nearly identical content or structure with minor pronoun and tense changes, though a few (notably 5, 6, 9, 12, and 13) introduce some narrative or stylistic variation, yielding low to moderate overall diversity.

per_prompt.prompt: Write about a character who keeps ending up in the same place.

pairwise_eval.degeneration_llm_reason: Several entries contain incomplete sentences, grammatical errors, repeated or unfinished clauses (e.g., 'and.', 'all thegl', 'keeps ended up'), and some broken/unintelligible phrases. Most are partially coherent, but degeneration is present in multiple answers.

llm_diversity.justification: The samples exhibit very minimal diversity as they all share the same 'Once upon a time' fairy-tale opening, nearly identical plot structure about a character repeatedly ending up in the same place, and only minor changes in character names and occasional small language errors.

per_prompt.prompt: Write a story featuring an element of time-travel or anachronism.

pairwise_eval.degeneration_llm_reason: Some answers show clear degeneration: [1] has a nonsensical ending ('She had a curious because.'), [5] has a garbled phrase ('in the a-d far past'), [8] includes broken numbering/characters ('early.8th8'), [12] has a double article and a missing article ('in a a small village', 'lived girl'), [13] has odd phrasing and broken line. Several others are slightly ungrammatical or incomplete. Most keep general coherence, but degeneration is nontrivial in several cases.

llm_diversity.justification: The samples show minimal diversity, as most follow highly similar 'once upon a time' openings, village/town settings, young female protagonists, and slight differences in names, with only minor variations in time period and language errors.

per_prompt.prompt: Start or end your story with someone saying “You’ll never know unless you try.”

pairwise_eval.degeneration_llm_reason: Moderate degeneration: multiple responses display repetitive phrases, minor grammatical errors, and mild incoherence. Some answers have truncated sentences, awkward repetition (e.g. 'you you try', 'I I know'), filler whitespace, a stray Unicode replacement character (�), and uneven narrative flow. Severe garbling or symbol/nonsense is absent, but degeneration is clearly present across many entries.

llm_diversity.justification: Most samples simply repeat or minimally rephrase the phrase 'You'll never know unless you try,' with few deviations in perspective, style, structure, or language, except for sample 14, which uniquely introduces a narrative plot.

per_prompt.prompt: Start your story with someone receiving a one-star review.

pairwise_eval.degeneration_llm_reason: Several responses are somewhat coherent but many have broken English, garbled tokens, incomplete or nonsensical sentences, and one abrupt symbol-only answer. There are also clear signs of language mixing and incoherence (e.g., [3], [11], [12], [14]).

llm_diversity.justification: Most samples are brief refusals to produce content, often with similar language and phrasing, with only a few that diverge stylistically or show elements of narrative structure, resulting in low overall diversity.

per_prompt.prompt: Start your story with a major news event breaking — one that will change the world forever.

pairwise_eval.degeneration_llm_reason: Multiple answers display degeneration: garbled content ([11]), abrupt/unfinished sentences ([2], [6]), language mixing ([11]), meaningless symbols ([0], [4], [5], [8], [9], [13]), placeholder formatting ([12]), and overall lack of coherence in several entries. A few are coherent ([7], [10], [14]) but the average is dragged down by the highly degenerated responses.

llm_diversity.justification: While a significant portion of the samples are empty or nearly empty (minimal language or content), some texts show meaningful variation in language (English, Chinese), style (news report, dialogue, narrative), and structure (headlines, fragmented sentences, conversational responses), which adds moderate diversity overall.

per_prompt.prompt: Two strangers meet at a New Year's Eve party. They spend the party together, and then never see each other again.

pairwise_eval.degeneration_llm_reason: Several responses are heavily degenerated: broken sentences, garbled text (e.g. [4], [8], [9], [13]), incoherent phrasing ([2], [11]), severe repetition ([2], [7]), language mixing and odd symbols ([4], [11], [8]). Most have minor to moderate errors, and a few are largely nonsensical. Average degeneration is high.

llm_diversity.justification: The text samples overwhelmingly share a nearly identical plot (two strangers meeting and parting on New Year's Eve), similar narrative style, and language patterns, with only minor variations in syntax, perspective, character names, and degree of narrative coherence, and very limited shifts in viewpoint, genre, or structure.

per_prompt.prompt: Write a post-apocalyptic romance.

pairwise_eval.degeneration_llm_reason: Multiple answers contain repetitions, incomplete sentences, nonsensical phrasing ('ruinsolate'), grammar issues, fragments, and loss of coherence. Several outputs (e.g., [4], [9], [10], [11], [12], [14]) are degenerated, though some are closer to coherent.

llm_diversity.justification: The samples mostly share similar themes, perspectives (post-apocalyptic romance or reflection), plot structures (focusing on survivors or pairs), and language style, with only slight variations and a few fragmented or minimal entries disrupting the overall homogeneity.

per_prompt.prompt: Write a day-in-the-life-story about a first-time parent and their newborn child.

pairwise_eval.degeneration_llm_reason: Majority of texts contain severe breakdowns in coherence, garbled phrases, repetition, language mixing (Chinese characters), nonsensical or incomplete sentences, misplaced names/roles, and random symbols. Severe degeneration present in most samples.

llm_diversity.justification: Most samples revolve around first-time parents and a newborn on a sunny or beautiful day, with similar style, perspective, and sentence structure, though there are minor variations in characters, time, a single fairy tale opening, and sporadic language deviations or errors.

per_prompt.prompt: Write a story that involves a mystery — it doesn't need to be crime-related, it should just include something that remains unexplained until the end.

pairwise_eval.degeneration_llm_reason: Many responses show mild to moderate degeneration: missing words, broken syntax, repetition ('a a'), awkward phrasing, strange inserts ('a young old woman named Mrs. Fortunately'), incomplete sentences, and some noun-verb mismatches. Most are not total nonsense but display clear coherence and grammar problems.

llm_diversity.justification: The samples all follow nearly identical openings, setting, and character archetypes, with minimal variation in perspective, plot structure, or language, leading to very low diversity overall.
